result.execSummary:
The defendant William R. Gunther was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Concurrent with: 14CF192

miscConds.notes: Obtain or maintain full time employment or work for family business.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.

No contact with E.C. or her mother.
No possession or consumption of alcohol, controlled substances, illegal drugs or prescription medication unless prescribed by a Dr. and then only according to Dr.'s orders and as approved by agent.

Maintain stable residence.
Counseling assessments and follow through as recommended by agent.

timeConds.notes:
Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.
No good time.
Concurrent with: 14CF192

Court imposes:  Imposed & Stayed 1 year 6 months initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision.  Concurrent to 14CF192.  Defendant is not eligible for CIP.  Defendant is eligible for SAP.  3 years probation, concurrent to 14CF192.  Conditions:  
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
60 days jail, no good time, work release, commencing 4-12-16 at 7pm, concurrent to 14CF192.
Costs & service fees from bond.
No contact with E.C. or her Mother.
No possession or consumption of alcohol, controlled substances, illegal drugs or prescription medication unless prescribed by a Dr. and then only according to Dr.'s orders and as approved by agent.

Counseling assessments and follow through as recommended by agent.
